thread.title: Dallas Cowboys ready for defensive upgrade next week with return of Greg Hardy, Rolando McClain
thread.title_full: Dallas Cowboys ready for defensive upgrade next week with return of Greg Hardy, Rolando McClain | Dallas Morning News

author: Brandon George
title: Dallas Cowboys ready for defensive upgrade next week with return of Greg Hardy, Rolando McClain
text:
IRVING -- No matter how the Dallas Cowboys' do against the New Orleans Saints on Sunday night, they'll improve by Monday morning. That's when Pro Bowl defensive end Greg Hardy and middle linebacker Rolando McClain rejoin the team after each served a four-game suspension to start the season.
Cowboys coach Jason Garrett said Friday he anticipates both players will be "ready to go" for practice Wednesday. McClain has been working out at Valley Ranch, but under the terms of Hardy's suspension he wasn't allowed to workout at the team facility.
Cowboys coaches haven't been allowed to have contact with Hardy during his suspension, but club athletic trainer Britt Brown was allowed to keep in touch with him.
Cowboys weak-side linebacker Sean Lee said he's excited for the return of McClain. With Lee missing all of last season, the two have yet to start a game alongside each other for the Cowboys.
"Can't wait for him to get back," Lee said. "He's ready to go. He's chomping at the bit to get back and he's been working extremely hard. He looks great. He's a natural. By next week, he'll be ready to practice and be ready to go."
